headline.main: E.P.A. Moves to Reduce Health Risks From Dioxin

docs.lead_paragraph: Calling the potential risk to human health from dioxin worrisome but significantly less than that posed by smoking, the Environmental Protection Agency said today that it was ready to take steps to reduce the chance that people would be exposed to harm from the toxic chemical. In a news conference, the agency said that in February it would propose rules for controlling dioxin and other air pollutants emitted by medical incinerators. These devices have been identified as a significant, uncontrolled source of the chemical compounds, which are byproducts of various industrial activities.
